name: Pisillo Italian Panini
address: 97 Nassau St, New York, NY 10038, USA

reviews.text: Amazing sandwiches.  Fresh and very high quality ingredients
Magical sandwich, top quality
Great sandwich for a celebration. One of the biggest subs I've ever seen. Sesame seed break for the win.
Riesen saftige Baguettes mit einer wahnsinnig groÃŸen Auswahl an BelÃ¤gen . Selbst das Baguette kann man aussuchen. Besser geht es nicht .
Great spot. Best sandwiches not gonna lie but they don't take credit card. So you can order ahead for a pick up on their website or use the ATM in the restaurant.  10/10 would recommend

Freshly sliced meats on HUGE sandwiches. Semolina bread was chewy and delicious. The hot peppers have kick so switch to sweet peppers if you donâ€™t handle heat. Cash only but you can order online to pay by card.
If this is not the best cold Italian sandwich in New York City, show me otherwise..

Anche se il locale Ã¨ situato a NY appena varchi l'ingresso ti sembra di stare in Italia, o meglio a Montesarchio :-) Cibo di qualitÃ , gentilezza e disponibilitÃ  del personale buono. Che dire nn si puÃ² nn andare da Pisillo per un buon panino.

Killer Italian sandwich. Great bread options made fresh everyday.  The semolina was amazing. Seeded on both sides.

About 30-40 menu choices quality ingredients, fast service.

The sandwich is literally huge. 20$ but would feed two grown men easy. Great spot for an area thatâ€™s not too food friendly. Canâ€™t recommend enough.
Quick service, fresh products and big portions. One of the best!
People who say this is the best sandwich ever, this sandwich is delicious, etc must be out of towners from places like Nebraska cuz this was mediocre

Lo cierto es que es un sitio bastante peculiar, se respira mucho ambiente italiano y estÃ¡ lleno de fotos del dueÃ±o y famosetes que han ido

Los bocadillos, que es lo principal que sirven aquÃ­,  son bastante grandes y la camarera tuvo un detalle recomendando que no cogiÃ©ramos dos, bastaba con uno para dos personas. Justo el que cogimos fue un poco arriesgado y no estaba extremadamente bueno pero habÃ­a otros muy ricos

Por ponerle una pega, solo aceptan pagos en  efectivo, de hecho tienen un cajero en la puerta jajaja

La localizaciÃ³n es perfecta si vas a ver la zona del 11s o el distrito financiero.

El local es pequeÃ±ito y no demasiado cÃ³modo pero tuvimos suerte de que estaba vacÃ­o cuando fuimos ya que era una hora rara.

Espero volver algÃºn dÃ­a y probar mÃ¡s bocadillos a ver si le subo a 5 estrellas.
Assolutamente da non perdere. Panini enormi, molto gustosi e ingredienti di ottima qualitÃ .

I love these sandwiches they are gigantic and filling and really hard to eat. The atmosphere inside is barely toeing the line between insufferable and lovable, leaning towards the latter, and that makes for a great experience. Note it is cash only but they have an ATM. I don't know what the fee is because I am smart enough to bring cash.

I stumbled upon this Italian sandwich shop in New York, and it was an absolute gem. Everything was simply perfect â€“ from the fresh, high-quality ingredients to the authentic flavors that transported me straight to Italy. The bread was warm and crispy on the outside, soft on the inside, and the fillings were generous and delicious.

The staff was friendly and welcoming, making the whole experience even better. The place has a cozy atmosphere, perfect for a quick bite or a relaxed meal.

If youâ€™re in New York and craving a true taste of Italy, this is a must-visit. Highly recommended!
The best paninis in town!

Pisillo is definitely one of my favorite sandwiches in the city and I have been coming here for ~ 5 years. I love taking visitors to NY here too. I will have to say that the Parma with the smoked mozzarella is probably my favorite but Iâ€™ve really experienced not a single miss here. The staff are always lovely and get sandwiches out efficiently! Also, theyâ€™re open reasonably late  for a sandwich shop thatâ€™s not Subway or a deli (8pm) so I do love being able to swing by after work.
Tips: 1. Some of the standard bread can be a little bit tough to chew (or maybe Iâ€™m just a weak sandwich eater and I get the wheat bread) but upgrading to the foccacia is a much softer and a bit lighter bread and the fillings have an easier time staying in the sandwich. 2: bring a friend to split with or plan to save half as these are super hefty as many people have said in the comments. Iâ€™ve had these sandwiches keep in the fridge overnight with no issue. 3: try the special if they have one! 4: bring cash!

We were looking for a place to have a quick lunch near the 9/11 Museum and what a great find. The sandwiches are unique, tasty and huuuuge. We shared a Parm sandwich and it filled us both up. Service was friendly and quick. Atmosphere and personable and fun. It made us feel like we were in Italy. Definitely worth stopping by when in Manhattan.
Just one thing: the ingredients are all Italian and not fake!! Well done! The guys are friendly and helpful! BRAVIIIIIII

amazing service, amazing manager, amazing food. I normally do NOT like subs, and this one was just phenomenal. manager took time to help me figure out what I would like :) so filling, will last you for days, and fresh ingredients - incredible value, especially considering the price. excited to be back soon!!

We ordered this after a brief skim for a delivery option in financial district that would be unique to New York. Incredible sandwiches. They are massive and dense and are giving us more meals than we expected. Delicious, prepared fast but well, absolutely fantastic quality bread and meats, and their sauces, spreads, and oils are quality and taste amazing. Nice piles of arugula too! This is a gem of a spot give them a shot.
The sandwiches are large enough to share and are great quality
Best sandwiches in NYC.
Great to go Italian sandwiches in the financial district.
The best Italian PANNINI. we got the #26 Pisillo. TO DIE FOR. bread was very fresh. Only gripe is the hard wooden stools but very  minor issue.

Un monde fou Ã  l'heure du dÃ©jeuner et on comprend pourquoi une fois qu'on a goÃ»tÃ©. Le panini italien dans toute sa splendeur. Pain maison garniture ultra gÃ©nÃ©reuse et produits merveilleux. On Ã©tait trois et on a rÃ©ussi Ã  venir Ã  bout de deux demi sandwichs alors prÃ©voyez que les portions sont trÃ¨s gÃ©nÃ©reuses (soyez Ã©tonnÃ©-e comme nous du poids du sandwich qui vous est remis aprÃ¨s commande ğŸ˜…). Un rÃ©gal!
Consigliatissimo per assaporare i gusti italiani
What an amazing sandwich, the ingredients were fresh and excellent and the portion matched with the price. I recommend without hesitation
Panini enormi, quasi esagerati. Prezzo alto ma giustificato per qualitÃ  e quantitÃ  degli ingredienti. Ragazzi molto gentili soprattutto la ragazza alla cassa.
Personale gentile e simpatico, panini ottimi e abbondanti, materie prime di ottima qualitÃ . Una tappa obbligatoria.
Ragazzi gentilissimi, panini ottimi, si consiglia vivamente
Tutto buonissimo e personale super gentile consiglio vivamente!!!
Tutto buonissimo panini grandi e staff eccezionale
very good staff and food
Personale gentilissimo

Pisillo offers the freshest and best sandwiches in the city. The breads and toppings are fresh, so you don't need any condiments. Their dressings are perfect. I highly recommend it. you also canâ€™t beat the price for what you get. Theyâ€™re huge sandwiches.
Best panino place in the city!

The portions are more than enough to feed two people, the quality of the food is always above and beyond and delivery is very prompt. The only â€œcomplaintâ€ is that there are too many delicious options to choose from! I want to try so many different sandwiches, but always go back to the delicious chicken with fresh mozzarella, arugula and roasted peppers.
DELICIOUS paninis, one of my favorite spots in nyc for food
Buena comida, buen trato, mucha simpatÃ­a!!!! Cosa que se agradece estando a tanto kms de casa, incluso me dejÃ³ que fuera a un ğŸ›’ enfrente, xq se le acabÃ³ la cerveza... Un crack!!! Volveremos

Small shop no frills, but no need for gimmicks when you have the best sandwich in Manhattan- especially in the Financial District. Amazing portion too! If you are working or visiting, donâ€™t let the humble outside fool you- step in or order online.
Delicious Italian Paninis.

Semplicemente fantastico!!

Simply fantastic!!
This place feels like a secret waiting to be discovered. I'll stop in next time I'm nearby. The cooking here is precise. The staff exceeded all expectations. This place shows remarkable quality.

Dayuuummmmmmmm. As you can see pisillo is excellent. This sandwichâ€™s dimensions are approximately LWH 1.5â€™ x 5â€ x 4â€ worth it every time. 4 stars for atmosphere because a group of youngsters walked in and flooded the place with their â€œvibezâ€

Carmelo Ã¨ semplicemente garanzia di qualitÃ  e simpatia, i suoi panini sono di una bontÃ  infinita e assaporandoli in sua compagnia Ã¨ come sentirsi a casa. Se volete un vero panino italiano Pisillo Ã¨ il posto giusto!

One of the best sandwiches I've ever had. The ingredients all compliment each other so well and are incredibly fresh. Bread was outstanding. Great portion for the price. Cannot recommend this spot enough.
Sandwiches are fresh. So good. There are a few tables but space is cramped. Recommended as takeout.
Outstanding sandwich. Perhaps the best in NYC. Fresh, large and delicious Italian products. Cant miss, you must try it.

If you like legit yummy sandwich, this place is phenomenal ğŸ‘Œ
And i don't eat meat? So, vegetarian friendly ğŸ˜‹

We had a great time with the sandwich & service!

Ordered the Pisillo - slightly messy but not at all hard to eat. The sauces dropped everywhere so definitely get extra napkins. Amazing bread and fillings. If the sauces could get soaked by the bread as we consume, that would be exceptional!

PS: cash only! Be ready!

** amazing staff! Exceptional hospitality!

I can say as a Brooklynite, without exaggeration, that this is currently my favorite place to eat food from in NYC. I used to work in this neighborhood, and now that I don't, I still think about these sandwiches at least once a week. I'm not going to claim you'll leave feeling as strongly as I do, but I do believe that if you like Italian sandwiches, you'll be highly satisfied by this place.

You can't really go wrong with whatever option you go for. My favorite is the Ariccia, but I've tried six or seven of these sandwiches and loved all of them. You're safe to go for whatever you think sounds tastiest to you on the menu. These sandwiches are also big. As someone whose stomach has been called a bottomless pit, eating a full sandwich at a time is doable, but I highly recommend splitting it between two meals or sharing it with someone.

All in all, I cannot recommend this place highly enough!

Muy buena opciÃ³n para comer al paso si estÃ¡s por la zona.
Los paninis son frescos y gigantes, tranquilamente comen 2 personas de uno solo. Los ingredientes son de gran calidad a excepciÃ³n del pan que no nos terminÃ³ de convencer ya que lo sirven frÃ­o.
La atenciÃ³n en todo momento fue sÃºper amable!

Panini giganti, uno Ã¨ assolutamente sufficiente per due persone.
Non ci Ã¨ molto piaciuto, il pane abbastanza buono ma ingredienti non di una grande qualitÃ , e sopratutto molto freddi.
Si potrebbe puntare un poâ€™ di piÃ¹ sulla qualitÃ , considerando la notorietÃ  del locale e la quantitÃ  di clienti.
Un poâ€™ vergognoso che si possa pagare solo in contantiâ€¦..

My wife and I definitely enjoyed our lunch here.  The sandwich was huge (we ordered the Parma), and it was made extremely fast.  All three employees thanked us while we were there, and even though the shop is tiny, there were enough places to sit for every who came in.

It is cash only in store - but you can use a card if you order online.

I finished my half of the sandwich there, and my wife ate part of hers there, and part of it later.  The flavor was there, and the smoked mozzarella with the sun-dried tomatoes were a great pairing.  The only complain I would have is that there was less meat than I thought there would be on the sandwich.  Maybe because if was prosciutto, and not something like salami or ham?  But it was still a very tasty, affordable ($18 for lunch for both of us) and fulfilling sandwich.  I would absolutely eat here again.

Donâ€™t let the little exterior fool you, this place has the BIGGEST and yummiest sandwiches ever. Donâ€™t question it, just go. There can be a long line sometimes. Recommend to order ahead online!

This is 26. Pisillo ($17.90) - prosciutto di parma, porchetta, bufala mozzarella, roasted peppers, arugula, balsamic dressing - on Ciabatta, but they said to get Sfilatino.

I ate it for 4 meals so worth the moneyğŸ¤—â¤ï¸

Finally decided to check this Italian panini shop. Didnâ€™t realize it was cash only until I got there. There is an ATM machine inside the shop. Thereâ€™s tables to sit and eat if youâ€™re not doing takeout. It wasnâ€™t as busy on a Saturday afternoon compared to on weekdays. I got #26, one of the top two best sellers here (the other being #5). I chose the sfilatino bread which I kind of regretted and shouldâ€™ve gotten a bread that was a bit softer. The panini is humongous. Def able to share with another person. The panini was good but not great. Enjoyed the buffalo mozzarella though.

SUCH quick service and wow!!! The weight of the sandwich for the cost?! Could not believe it! Mustâ€™ve weighed at least 5 lbs for 2 sandwiches. We had 26 and 27 for two people and they cut it in thirds for us. We had 2/6 pieces leftover! The quality of the ingredients was five star. You can taste the love that is put into this restaurant!  Will definitely be back. Thereâ€™s no where else like it

Quality was amazing! Massive sandwich for a good price. I got the Italian on multigrain and asked to add hots. FYI their Italian doesnâ€™t have multiple meats like you get at other places like jersey mikes. The guy working made sure to give me a heads up which I appreciated! Got sandwich to go. Casual seating inside if you want to eat there. Cash only!
Every sandwich is absolutely authentic, simple and amazing. Your basic Italian Panini shop.

Die besten Sandwiches, die ich jemals gegessen habe. Die Portionen sind so riesig, dass man Ã¼ber den ganzen Tag sonst nichts mehr essen muss. Zudem gibt eine unendlich groÃŸe Auswahl, sodass wirklich jeder fÃ¼ndig wird. Preise gehen fÃ¼r diese riesigen GrÃ¶ÃŸen in Ordnung. Negativ ist leider, dass man nur bar zahlen kann, aber immerhin gibt es einen Geldautomaten im Laden. Ein paar mehr SitzplÃ¤tze wÃ¤ren auÃŸerdem schÃ¶n.

Fresh, massive, and delicious sandwichesâ€”Pisillo is a fantastic addition to the neighborhood. The shop is spotless, the Italian music sets the vibe, and the staff are warm and efficient. I accidentally ordered to the wrong location, and they immediately made both sandwiches again on the spotâ€”no questions asked. Great service. Iâ€™ll definitely be back.
Åšwietne wÅ‚oskie kanapki, bardzo sycÄ…ce i idealne na kaÅ¼dÄ… porÄ™. Jako polak ktÃ³ry uwielbia wÅ‚oskie jedzenie mogÄ™ szczerze poleciÄ‡!

So one of my coworkers mentioned to me that this is his favorite sandwich in the city. Hearing that I had to give it a try and let me tell youâ€¦it did not disappoint. Itâ€™s an old school, small little shop that still is cash only. Thereâ€™s about 40 different types of sandwiches and each one is made fresh right in front of you. I ordered the 17 which included prosciutto, buffalo mozzarella, arugula and a balsamic dressing. It was loaded with meat and cheese and the dressing was delicious. For about $16 you get like a 15-16in sandwich. Enough for leftovers the next day. I cannot wait to go back and give a few of the other sandwiches a try!

Nice old-school deli serving tasty sandwiches. Lots of options to choose from and the portions will not leave you hungry. Things to be aware of - service was a little slow during peak hours and it is a cash only business. Recommend ordering ahead for pickup.

Posto molto confortevole, a due passi dal WTC, pulito, con personale molto accomodante e socievole, ma soprattutto, sono veri italiani!!!
Ho assaggiato il panino "Pisillo" ed Ã¨ una poesia per il palato...
Qui, alla domanda "serve altro?"
Non risponderete "si, un cacciavite ed una scala", alla Checco Zalone!!!
ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£ğŸ¤£
Consigliatissimo.
P.s. accetta solo contanti, ma nel locale Ã¨ presente un comodissimo ATM.
Excelente atenciÃ³n, calidad y servicio, sandwich gigantes, para compartir entre 2 o 3 personas, fiambres cortados en el momento, todo muy bueno, 100% recomendable

Anybody giving this place less than 5 stars is lying to you. This is a solid contender for one of the best sandwich spots in the city.

First, itâ€™s an old school cash only establishment and you definitely get that homey feel when you walk in. Pictures on the wall. Italian flag. Very good atmosphere.

There are a lot of sandwich options. But the best part is if you order a sandwich, youâ€™ll get one ready for you in less than 2 minutes.

Letâ€™s get into the food. You can tell the bread is great quality because of the flour residue left on it. I got the New Yorker which is a chicken breast sandwich with peppers mozzarella and dressing. Will not lie, that first bite packed so much flavor. Perfect blend of ingredients in a sandwich that can feed you for breakfast, lunch, and a midnight snack. It honestly is a wonderfully crafted sandwich and for $16, it feels like youâ€™re underpaying.

You absolutely wonâ€™t be disappointed eating here. One of the best spots in FiDi.

The panino @Pisillo was super! Had the Roma, and it was absolutely delicious, stuffed with truly fresh ingredients and made with care!
Would highly recommend it, great value for money too- speaking of which they accept cash only so be prepared (they do have a small ATM machine inside but you know charges at those ones).
Will definitely return :)

Best deli in NYC.

Went for: takeout lunch during work.

Food:
Sandwiches - all are amazing. The high quality imported ingredients are insanely authentic. Flavors just as imagined as Italy.

Sandwiches are big!! Donâ€™t be ashamed to share. Add Ingredients as you wish, but donâ€™t be sad if the staff tells you no.

Canâ€™t wait to try all 23.

Excelente atenciÃ³n, muy amables. La comida muy buena, solo tener en cuenta que los sÃ¡ndwiches los sirven frÃ­os. El sandwich es enorme y lo compartimos entre dos, y no lo terminamos =). El ambiente lo califique con 4 estrellas porque serÃ­a ideal que sea mÃ¡s grande.

Been trying to get down here ever since my buddy informed me that the sister spot in Chelsea made incredible sandwiches.   Light work day for a Friday so I rounded up some coworkers to take a walk to the shop.  It's Cash Only with an ATM in the establishment if you are short of cash. I believe the boss was working the slicer.  I got the #1 The Milano on the white roll, under $20, weighed about 5lbs and it was absolutely delicious.  I couldn't finish the whole sandwich, only able to eat half so I saved the rest for dinner. It was still delicious about 7 hours later.

This was a great find. Very small shopfront but big on flavour. The panini are huge and the variety is vast. A really enjoyable lunch stop. We had the porchetta with smoked mozzarella- enough to share for two.
